name: inductor production, auxilliaries and energy use | inductor, auxilliaries and energy use | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1165/documentation

This dataset represents the average production efforts for the production of 1 kg of inductors over all types of inductors. There is no distinction between the different types of inductors produced. Data for auxiliaries, energy, emissions and waste are taken from the Swedish LCI database and based on estimations from the capacitor production. As the raw material input is taken into account in the respective inductor datasets this dataset here has no input of raw materials. 

From reception of electronic components, raw materials and auxiliares at the factory gate.

This module includes auxillary and energy consumption, emissions (air, water) and waste amounts, as well as an estimation of the efforts for transportation and of the infrastructure for the production of inductors.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from literature and one global producer – here representing the global situation.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Most inductors are constructed as a coil out of conducting material (e.g. copper wire) that is wrapped around a core of air or of ferromagnetic material. The higher the permeability of the core material, the higher is the inductance of the component. One part of the inductors is constructed as enamel coated wire wrapped around a ferrite bobbin with wire exposed on the outside. Some inductors have an adjustable core, which enables changing of the inductance. Those inductors that are used to block very high frequencies can contain a wire passing through a ferrite cylinder or bead.;average production comprising the following steps: core mounting; epxoy-curing; winding; welding; molding; marking; bending; testing and final control.

exchanges.description:
An inductor is a passive electrical device employed in electrical circuits for its property of inductance. An inductor can take many forms. Synonyms for the term "inductor" that are in use are "coil" and "choke" (Wikipedia, 2007). While a capacitor opposes changes in voltage, an inductor opposes changes in current. An ideal inductor would offer no resistance to a constant direct current; however, only superconducting inductors have truly zero electrical resistance.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Proxy. A total output of 1.13 kg of waste per kg of produced capacitors is calculated. Auxiliaries are emitted 100% either as emissions (air, water, soil) or as waste - i.e. 0.48 kg of waste are non-used input materials - and for 50% here of this byproduct is used as a proxy.

Further references:
CPM (2006) LCI@CPM datastore - various datasets about electronic components. Download of December 12, 2006, from <http://databases.imi.chalmers.se/nukes/index.html>.
